name: platonic
description: Regular, convex polyhedra, constructed with the same number of congruent regular polygons meeting at each vertex.

name: archimedean
description: Semi-regular convex polyhedra composed of regular polygons meeting in identical vertices.

name: prisms
description: Polyhedra comprising two 𝑛-sided polygonal bases and 𝑛 square faces joining the two.

name: antiprisms
description: Polyhedra composed of two parallel copies of an 𝑛-sided polygon, connected by an alternating band of triangles.

name: johnson
description: Strictly convex, non-uniform polyhedra, whose faces are regular polygons.
